page.title: 15NATURAL HISTORY,Yeoford.
page.content: This morning we went on a trip to West Studham, last time we had to go in two bus loads but we did not have to this time because eight were ill. Most of them had chickenpox, including Sara who lives at West Studham. A naturalist showed us around.He took us to the wood.The farmer who owns the land, has 75 acres, 13 wood, 9 rough pasture, 5 orchard (mixed), 48 permanent _ 11 hay, 240 sheep _ 120 ewes, 3 rams and 117 lambs, slowly going. Did you know that the most important thing in the whole world is the green leaf because a leaf gives off oxygen and brings in carbon dioxide which we must not breathe in? We saw many different kinds of trees in the wood and a great many varieties of plants. We saw some orchids. It is a good area for butterflies but the sun wasn't out.
